clinical_study.official_title: Getting it Right: Towards Responsible Social Media Use During a Pandemic (COVID-19)

brief_summary.textblock: In this protocol, we seek to examine the role of social media in information spread during a pandemic. As there have been few pandemics in the last decade (coinciding with the rise of social media), its use in this context remains understudied. This study hence intends to: (1) characterize the nature of social media use, (2) understand the impact of social media use, and (3) understand how to communicate accurate information.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in DASS scores across 9 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: Twice: once during initial enrollment, and then 8 days after
primary_outcome.description: 21-item validated scale assessing symptoms of depression, anxiety and stress (DASS-21): Min score = 0, Max score = 21; higher score indicates a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in fear with regards the COVID-19 situation across 1 week
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week, starting from date after initial DASS survey completion
primary_outcome.description: 1 item each day on fear specifically of the COVID-19 situation (measured on a 4 point scale: min = 1, max = 4; higher scores indicating greater fear about the outbreak).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in amount of thinking about the COVID-19 situation across 1 week
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 week, starting from date after initial DASS survey completion
primary_outcome.description: 1 item each day on how much they thought about the outbreak that day (measured on a 5 point scale: min = 1, max = 5; higher scores indicating more thinking about the outbreak).

arm_group.description: We plan to recruit a representative sample of the Singapore population.

intervention.description: Daily reports of social media use and consumption, including reports on receiving and disseminating news articles related to the COVID-19 situation (e.g., how many messaging groups shared news on the outbreak, how many items related to the outbreak they forwarded to others, etc).

study_pop.textblock: Representative sample of the Singapore population

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 21 years
- Has stayed in Singapore for at least 2 years
- Has a WhatsApp account that can be used for the research study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below 21 years
- Has stayed in Singapore for less than 2 years
- Does not have a WhatsApp account that can be used for the research study
